pullRequest.body: `LazyList` was deprecated in Batteries (with an indication to use `MLList` instead). The uses in Mathlib were trivial, as they were immediately forced to a `List` anyway. This PR deprecates the code about `LazyList`, and replaces the lazy-but-not-really code with strict versions.

Unfortunately GitHub does not let me comment there, but the import of `Batteries.Data.LazyList` in `Mathlib/Testing/SlimCheck/Functions.lean` can be deleted (the shake linter also caught this, thankfully).

LGTM otherwise!

bors d+

```suggestion
/-- A list, in decreasing order, of sizes that should be
```
I was wondering if we should add a pointer to `MLList` here, but it's probably fine since `LazyList` already says so in the deprecation warning.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: update Batteries and deprecate LazyList
